result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason C Sanford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Marijuana - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash applied.  Balance to be paid within 20 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason C Sanford

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 08-12-2022.
2:19 PM Case not called on the record, parties signed stipulation and order.
Defendant failed to properly sign cash bond as ordered by the Court. Upon signing cash bond, warrant may be quashed and defendant released. $100.00 bond money was posted.

Defendant faxed bond back with NO notary. Bond needs to be re-done.
Defendant has been contacted numerous times by staff with instructions on how to have bond signed and notarized. No response from defendant as to sending corrected bond 06/08/22 cw
Def called with fax number to send Cash Bond to be signed and faxed back
Pre-trial conference on August 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

USE $100.00 CASH BAIL ALREADY ON DEPOSIT.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

10:33 AM Defendant Jason C Sanford appeared by Zoom.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
The Court orders the Clerk's office to mail a complaint to the Defendant's new address.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Court advises of right to an attorney.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Check Case scheduled for June 6, 2022.

The Court notes that the address on the bond is not whewre the summons was mailed to.
The Court orders the the State to re-summons the Defendant.
The Court will adjourn.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
